intro: Euphrasia achibuenoensis, commonly known as the Achibueno's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Euphrasia achibuenoensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential medicinal properties.
